sweet.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: containing or having a taste like sugar
sweet.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: How sweet of you to remember my birthday!
sweet.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Your little boy looks very sweet in his new coat.
sweet.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: making you feel pleased, happy, and satisfied
sweet.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: the sickly sweet (=unpleasantly sweet) smell of rotting fruit
sweet.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: She has a very sweet singing voice.
sweet.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: if you describe water or air as sweet, you mean that it is fresh and clean
sweet.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: She hurried to the door and took great gulps of the sweet air.
sweet.translation[0].note_box[0].section: sweet food or drink has had sugar added or contains natural sugars
a cup of hot sweet tea
sweet because a lot of sugar has been added
Sugary foods are bad for your teeth.
The dessert was rather sweet and sickly.
I find strawberry and peach drinks too cloying.
the cloying smell of fish oil
sweet.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: used to say that you think that something is very good
sweet.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: ‘I got four tickets to the concert.’ ‘Sweet!’
sweet.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a small piece of sweet food made of sugar or chocolate
sweet.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Eating sweets is bad for your teeth.
a packet of boiled sweets (=hard sweets that taste of fruit)
sweet.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: sweet food served after the meat and vegetables part of a meal
sweet.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Would you like a sweet, or some cheese and biscuits?
